solution_line_template: {num_foxes} foxes catch {weasels_per_fox_per_week} weasels each every week for a total of {num_foxes}*{weasels_per_fox_per_week} = <<{num_foxes}*{weasels_per_fox_per_week}={weasels_caught_per_week}>>{weasels_caught_per_week} weasels

{weasels_caught_per_week} weasels are caught every week for {num_weeks} weeks for a total of {weasels_caught_per_week}*{num_weeks} = <<{weasels_caught_per_week}*{num_weeks}={total_weasels_caught}>>{total_weasels_caught} weasels

{num_foxes} foxes catch {rabbits_per_fox_per_week} rabbits each every week for a total of {num_foxes}*{rabbits_per_fox_per_week} = <<{num_foxes}*{rabbits_per_fox_per_week}={rabbits_caught_per_week}>>{rabbits_caught_per_week} rabbits

{rabbits_caught_per_week} rabbits are caught every week for {num_weeks} weeks for a total of {rabbits_caught_per_week}*{num_weeks} = <<{rabbits_caught_per_week}*{num_weeks}={total_rabbits_caught}>>{total_rabbits_caught} rabbits
There were originally {initial_weasels} weasels so now there are {initial_weasels}-{total_weasels_caught} = <<{initial_weasels}-{total_weasels_caught}={weasels_left}>>{weasels_left} weasels left
There were originally {initial_rabbits} rabbits so now there are {initial_rabbits}-{total_rabbits_caught} = <<{initial_rabbits}-{total_rabbits_caught}={rabbits_left}>>{rabbits_left} rabbits left
There are {weasels_left}+{rabbits_left} = <<{weasels_left}+{rabbits_left}={total_left}>>{total_left} weasels and rabbits left
